headline: Cranberry Sauce Extraordinaire
description: A variety of fresh and dried fruits and nuts are used in this cooked cranberry sauce. Serve with turkey.
name: Cranberry Sauce Extraordinaire

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan, boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Reduce the heat to simmer, and stir in cranberries, pureed orange, apple, pear, dried fruit, pecans, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries burst. Remove from heat, and let cool to room temperature.

review.reviewBody: This cranberry sauce was a hit! I will definitely make this for many of our holiday get togethers.

I just made this and it is fantastic. I did decrease the sugar to 3/4 cup and used 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup apple cider for the liquid. I used dried cherries and apricots as my dried fruits, and added a cinnamon stick to the mixture as it was cooking. I will definitely be making this for Thanksgiving. A nice change from classic cranberry sauce.

My search for the ultimate cranberry sauce ended when I tried this one a few years back--it's food fit for the gods. For the dried fruit I use mango, pineapple, and apricots. I thought the cinnamon taste was a bit strong so I cut that and the nutmeg, as well as the pecans in half. As delicious as it is, it's utterly amazing mixed into some good Greek yogurt. Can't recommend this recipe highly enough!

I found this recipe years ago and it's becomes one of our family favorites. My kids say it's not Thanksgiving or Christmas without it! It's perfectly wonderful as written (except for the nuts), but I like to add a bit of fresh lemon juice and I also zest both the lemon and the orange. We love dried cherry craisins for the dried fruit.
A new family tradition

This is an easy recipe to follow. I doubled the recipe because I wanted to give some away as gifts. Easy to make and place in jars with a bath canner for 15’. I tried some while warm and it was great. Not to sweet and nit to tart. The only issue I have was once it cooled the orange flavor was obsolete and the cinnamon flavor was powerful. I even decreased my cinnamon and added an extra orange with orange extract so I’m not sure what happened. I usually make another recipe but this one sounded so good. It is better as far as sweetness. It was a great addition to my sliced turkey sandwich that I had for lunch and it’s great on oatmeal! We’ve also used it as jam on our toast and pancakes! Thank you for posting. Easy peasy and great gift idea during the holidays.
Turned out fabulous ! Will make it a traditional recipe every year!
Love this recipe! Skip the nuts.

This was good, but it is more of a salad instead of a sauce. I ended up adding a container of cool whip and marshmallows. I made "Holiday Cranberry Sauce" at the same time to compare the two recipes. I prefer the Holiday Cranberry Sauce.
Amazing cranberry sauce. Only change I made was to reduce the sugar by a little less than a quarter cup. Will definitely make again and again!! Thanks!!
If you're looking for preserves/jam, this is five star. However, I like a tart cranberry sauce. I can see how this will go over well with those who usually don't like cranberry sauce.
It's not Thanksgiving without these cranberries. Don't change a thing!
This is without a doubt the Best Cranberry Sauce I have ever eaten! Everyone loved it!
Even my family who only liked jellied cranberry sauce in a can loved this full berry recipe. I plan to make it a new Thanksgiving tradition.
I made this by the recipe but the cinnamon flavor was over powering. No compliments from the guests for this recipe.
Everyone loved this!

I have made this every Thanksgiving for the last few years and I love it more each year. It's perfectly balanced with tart and sweet, crunchy and fruity. It's great as a side with stuffing and turkey - but it's also wonderful on top of vanilla ice cream.
This recipe was amazing! I didn’t use pears, it was still delicious.
I Loved cranberry sauce. I wouldn't change a thing. And will definitely make again
Absolutely fabulous...like a dessert. Wonderful flavors and textures...It was a huge hit and will definitely be my “go to” recipe for cranberry sauce!

By far the BEST cranberry sauce I have ever made! I ran out of cinnamon and used allspice in it's place and it was amazing! Have someone who hates cranberry sauce? Have them try this one. I turned non-believers into believers at work with this one.

Came out very good, but not my favorite cranberry sauce recipe. Still, to be fair, I made tons of changes without knowing the outcome so that may not be a fair judgment of the original. I just utilized the ideas that attracted me to this recipe. Next time I’d use les salt, though. I like my sauce more tangy than sweet, and I like it chunky. I didn’t want to drown out the cranberry flavor with pureeing everything so I kept the additions chopped.

I love this recipe. I pretty much followed the recipe. I cut back on the sugar. And as another reviewer posted, I added the cranberries to the boiling sugar water and let them boil for a few minutes. For the dried fruit I used dates and a few prunes, (it was all I had in the house.). These are the best cranberries I have made in years. I might have to make them every year. I hope the others eat the canned cranberry sauce.
I used a heaping 1/2 cup measuring cup of Splenda instead of sugar.

the yellow apricot made the color lighter, I had to add dark dried cranberry. 
1 cup pecan is too much , the consistency is too grainy and not smooth like a traditional sauce.
I used squeezed orange instead of water but I had to keeps adding water.I think I need to simmer it longer but I could barely see the cranberries .
So good..I added ground cloves also!..super

I have made this for years. It's such an easy recipe and everyone always asks for the recipe. This will be the 9th year I've made it...always amazing. It's easy to change too as a base recipe - add more fruit of your choice or less, more or less cinnamon to your liking, some brown with the white sugar, etc. 
Delicious on all meats, toast or just out of the refrigerator. Stores well - and blends as it stores. Even if you don't like cranberries...I think you'll like this one!
Amazing!! I make this every thanksgiving and the whole family just raves over it. Made it as written. For the dried fruit I usually use apricots, plums and cranberries
One of my favorite winter side dishes is a cranberry relish/sauce and this one hit it out of the park. My house smells amazing while it cooks on the stove and the flavor is to die for.
Hubs loved it and I make it for him every holiday (first time with this recipe). New "go to" for this sauce. -- (Thanksgiving 2019), Made this again. Another hit. Absolutely delish. Thanks!
love it! done it every year for thanksgiving and xmas, this year is going on top of cream cheese for new year's party appetizer.
Maybe I did something wrong, but I think I’ll go back to my old standby recipe.
This was delicious. I just used dried cherries for the dried fruit. Lots of compliments!! Saved this one and plan to make it again.

Amazing!!! It's sweet with a touch of tart. Just the way I like it! The family loved it also. I used dried cranberries, apricots, and pineapple for my dried fruit. I would highly recommend this recipe.
The flavors in this were phenomenal and I wouldn't change anything about the way it tasted. And though my dad really liked the nuts in it, the rest of us didn't. Next time, no nuts for us. :)

This recipe is delicious! I've made it -as is - over and over throughout the years, and we really like it. It's far better than store-boughten cranberry sauce; it's in a completely different class! I highly recommend this recipe. It's delicious over cream cheese with Ritz crackers!!!

This is excellent recipe! I have made it the past two yrs and my family loves it. 3 things I do differently. I doubled the recipe, omitted the dried fruit, and instead instead of water I replaced it with 1 cup orange per bag of cranberries. It helps to sweeten the Cranberries and soften some of the tartness.
It really is the best cranberry sauce I have ever had. I did add a bit more sugar to cut the tartness down.

Yum! I thought this would be very sweet, but it wasn’t at all. It is sweet and tart. Delicious. I did not add the dried fruit because that is to rough on the stomach, well it is for me. I added about 3/4 cup sugar in the raw not white so maybe that’s why it wasn’t too sweet. I actually added a few droppers full of liquid stevia to sweeten it up. I hope my guests like it because I do.

More of a chutney than a sauce but VERY good. Made as directed. Would not change a thing except one could add about 3/4 tsp red pepper flakes to make it a little spicy. This would be good with pork also.
SO good...make sure you make extra!
I DIDN'T MAKE ANY CHANGES. I WILL WAIT UNTIL I try it to decide if I WILL make it again.

I have been making this for 15 years - leftover become part of a brie pastry shell appetizer. Use it to replace the cranberry part of Wolfgang Puck's Savory Squash Soup. In other words, one batch of this goes a looong way! The best!
This is a must for every Christmas dinner!

This is addictive and so easy to make. You will be scraping the bottom of your cooking dish. I followed directions with a few changes. 

Threw all ingredients in the slow cooker & cooked on low for five hours. Do leave in for full five hours as it takes a long time for nutmeg flavor to diffuse - tried the sauce half way through and did not like strong nutmeg flavor, however at the end of five hours it was imperceptible.

1) Instead of cup of water: 1/4 cup #Cheribundi Tart cherry juice (cold) + 3/4 c boiling water. I think any fruit juice would work.
2) 1/2 cup of sugar instead of a cup as recommended by others. Dissolved the sugar in the hot liquid before adding to slow cooker. 
3) Used dried Cherry Fruit Medley bits from a local produce store which included equal amounts of chopped cherries, peaches, pears, golden raisins, apricots
4) For my pear, used a ripe Bosc

Since we are diabetic, I make homemade. It comes out great every time and no one can tell the difference. I like the idea of using various dry fruit. I have some black currants to use this year not zante. I can't wait. We have loads of pecans so they will be included. I don't puree the orange, but I dice it and add juice left over from cutting.

This is the first time I've ever made homemade cranberry sauce, and I am so glad I picked this recipe! I had to make a few exceptions, because I didn't have the stuff. I only added 1 medium sized apple, and I only had dried cranberries for the fruit. Other than that, all was the same. This cranberry sauce is even better the 2nd and 3rd days. I was eating it on biscuits! It's like a cranberry preserve and so so delicious! I will never go back to the canned stuff again! Thanks for the recipe!
This was excellent. there was so much left over (it made a lot) My daughter suggested making a streusel topping. I did and it made a great crisp!

I've been making this extraordinary sauce for about 6 or 7 years, but this is the first time my family has gotten to try it. They want it for other times as well, "Not just Thanksgiving!"
I already knew it was going to be a treat, because I have tried different recipes from different people, grandmothers included, and none of them ever matched up to this really simple delicious cranberry dish. Do not change a thing, unless you're just going to double the recipe and freeze some!

This cranberry sauce was awesome! I halfed the amount of sugar because I still wanted it to retain some good cranberry flavor. With all of the sweet fruit in the recipe I didn't want it to be overly sweet. It came out so perfect
This was a hit at my house for Thanksgiving. I used orange juice instead of water and just 1/2 cup of sugar. My daughter put some in her oatmeal the next day for breakfast.
This has become a family favorite! Even I love it and I'm not a cranberry fan.

Everyone loved this. I didn’t have any apples left, and I didn’t use the nuts or dried mix fruit. I’m sure it would have added more to the flavor if I did. I doubled the recipe and I have plenty leftover.

Very easy. Very good! used one granny smith apple, one orange plus zest, craisins. Didn't have any raisins and pecans would be a great addition... yummy chutney. Great also over cream cheese for appetizer." Reminds me of Hobby Lobby":

I didn't have a pear. Used dried cherries, blueberries and raisins. I used the whole orange including the peel . Put all fruit except cranberries in the Vitamix for a few pulses and then added to cranberries. This is much better and more interesting than plain cranberry sauce.

This stuff is addictive! We eat it by the spoonful, ok bowlful. I've made it twice and the family's requesting it again. Following another reviewer's tip, I use a can of mandarin oranges. I use the juice from the can as part of the cup of water. Also, I can't ever seem to get a pear ripe when I need it, so I just use two different varieties of apple. And we're kind of traditional, so I use dried cranberries instead of the mixed fruit. It's amazing. Try it. You will LOVE it! Thanks so much for the original post.
I substitute a small can of pineapple tidbits (drained) for the pear and I think it makes it a little bit better. Otherwise, great recipe.
I have been making this sauce for eight years! Turns out very good.

I make this every year for Thanksgiving. I double the recipe so I can send some home with the leftovers. The only things I do differently is I omit the cinnamon. I made it one year with the cinnamon and didn’t really like the difference it made to the flavor. I also omit the nuts because my granddaughter has a severe nut allergy.
inspiring recipe, bag and a half cranberries, dried and canned pineapple chunks, dried chili mango chunks,(amazon) otherwise followed recipe for a deliciously different cranberry sauce.

My family has loved this cranberry sauce for years. Today I had some leftover from Thanksgiving dinner so I decided to serve it with waffles...OMG! So good! I will always do this from now on...a new Thanksgiving tradition for sure!

I've made this a number of times now, and I've finally settled on "my version". I use about 1/4 c of sugar instead of a full cup, use a small can of mandarin oranges in place of the fresh orange, add a small can of crushed pineapple, and if I can't find good pears, I use 2 apples instead. Once everything has cooked and completely cooled, and I add a pint of fresh blueberries. I try to cook at least the day before to give all the flavors time to meld, but I don't add the pecans until just before serving so they don't get mushy. Terrific recipe as is - all of my little modifications are just personal preferences.

This is one of the best cranberry sauces I have ever made. It is very simple, yet extremely good tasting. I did use less sugar, as we are watching our sugar intake. And, I did omit the dried fruit. My family loved the mixture of flavors and even asked for seconds. I will be making this again and again for many years to come.

I exchanged the sugar with 1/2 cup of honey, the second time I made it.
I just find honey to be a more natural flavor that doesn't cover the taste of the individual fruits. Either way, it is delicious and will be a traditional holiday sauce in my house.

I added cloves. This recipe is one of my favorite Thanksgiving dishes. I always receive rave reviews and recipe requests when I bring it to share. More of a chutney than traditional sauce but it really is extraordinarily delicious! Easy to make a day ahead and then reheat. One less thing to make day of! I also add extra pecans.
This is the BEST tastiest cranberry sauce Ive ever had! I've made it every year now for 4 years and so look forward to it! I make extra and freeze it. Yummy!

Sensational recipe--I've had people who claim they don't like cranberry sauce enjoy this. As written, the cinnamon and nutmeg are almost overpowering, so I cut those in half and the finished dish is much more nicely balanced. Otherwise I follow the recipe exactly. The leftovers make a great breakfast or snack when mixed with some plain yogurt.
I think this is so good! My older sister and I had done with ice cream add a topping it's that good.
Outstanding best I ever had had to make a second Bach for Christmas
A staple on my table every holiday. Known as Tracey's Awesome Sauce.
I love the recipe just the way it is but sometimes I take out the cup of dried mix fruit and add 1 cup of fresh raspberries. Delicious either way.

I made this for Thanksgiving for my entire, extended family. Everyone raved about it. It was so tasty that I found myself sneaking spoonfuls straight out of the bowl . The second time I made it I sub'd out half of the sugar for Splenda. Tasted exactly the same. I will never make any other cranberry recipe. This one is just that good.

PHENOMENAL!! I have never like cranberries, but for whatever reason got the desire to make for Christmas dinner. Read many recipes and reviews and settled on this one. Made exactly as it is written and I'm now addicted!! This was outstanding and received many compliments from my guests. This will become a yearly Christmas standard. As other reviews have said, if you don't like cranberries, try this recipe and you'll be hooked!!
I made it as directed but without pears and replaced the dried fruit with raisins. Works out great every time.

GOOD EASY This is really good and fairly fast to make.
I used can of drained mandarins , no pear and mixed
dried fruit, and cherries. This is going to be good over 
Brie or cream cheese and bagels,,can't wait.

This was an excellent recipe! I made this almost exactly as written. I used dried apricots, cranberries and orange cranberries as my dried fruit. I also omitted the salt. I didn't feel like it needed it at all. This takes cranberry sauce to a whole new level. Well done and thanks for sharing!!!
I made this a few years ago and it was a huge hit. Getting ready for my turn to host again so had to look it up. I omitted the dried fruit and used 2 oranges. It seems like a pretty flexible recipe.
Best cranberry sauce ever. Even my girlfriend who hates cranberry sauce loved this.

Crazy delicious! The recipe lends itself to customization: I used half the sugar, left the skin on the apple, and skipped the nuts. It is the best cranberry sauce we've ever had and may very well have been the best dish on our Thanksgiving table. Well worth the minimal effort that it requires.

I will definitely make this cranberry sauce again. I omitted the nuts and next time I would go easy on the nutmeg. It didn't firm up as much as I was hoping while it was cooling so I let it sit in a tight sieve for a minute so some of the juice leaked out and then the consistency was perfect.
I made this for Thanksgiving. Absolutely fantastic. My guests raved about it. When dinner was over they all wanted to take the leftovers home. Absolutely great!

This is the best cranberry sauce ever. I make it every year for thanksgiving no matter where we go. Everyone agrees its the best they have ever had. It goes so well with the rest of dinner. I like to MASH everything with a potato masher at the end. This gives it a smoother texture and dark cranberry color.

This cranberry sauce is the best ever. My 22 year old son has been making this for the last 3 years now. Before this, neithor he or my daughter would touch cranberry sauce. Growing up on canned or jarred food, who thought homemade could be so heavenly. It's so good its like eating a special treat. It's wonderful warm or cold. I hope I don't get into it before tomorrow:)

Although it was tasty, it was not to my taste. Some of my guests loved It and ate it with celery, which gave it quite an unusual but good flavor. It was way too swe, but that it was a beautiful holiday red. My only substitution was four clementines instead of one orange.
the only change I made was I omitted the nuts. People ask me every Thanksgiving to please bring the cranberry sauce. Everyone loves it.
I followed the recipie exactly and it turned out great!

WOW! WOW! WOW!
I just made this for Thanksgiving tomorrow. 
I followed the recipe except used canned pear. 
The apple I had was huge so I only added half.
I puréed the orange in my nutribullet.
My kitchen smells heavenly. 
It looks exactly like the picture! 
It's very tasty warm, I may serve it that way, if there is any left (I can't stop eating it!)

Followed the recipe as written. Used a golden apple, red pear, naval orange and for dried fruit 1/2 apricot and 1/2 craisens and just used pumpkin pie spice and a pinch of salt. Third or 4th year making it and always a hit. I did add a touch of honey when it was finished as the berries were a bit tart this year. This is a must try, esp for those that say they don't like cranberry sauce.
So easy to make and everyone that's had it, loves it.

I had to use a canned jellied cranberry sauce (Mexico ) but, I added 1 pear, 2 mandarines off my tree, 1 small apple, dried cranberries, handful of walnuts & pecans. Put in blender, added to canned jellied cb. No sugar, no o.j. Is delish!

As some reviewers suggested, I halved the sugar. By doing this though, I found it too tart for me (even with the sweet fruits) so I did add the full amount later. When dissolving it, I used half water and half orange juice. I also used a can of drained mandarin oranges to make it easier, coarsely chopping so they wouldn't be in whole pieces. For fruits, I used dried cherries, cranberries and apricots. I'd chop my pecans a little finer the next time; I would prefer that over the larger pieces I had. I also added about a tblsp of brandy to the mixture. It's cooling now but will be great for Thanksgiving this week, and I'm thinking even to gift for Christmas. Nice recipe!
This was delicious, didn't change a thing ,

i have made this for thanksgiving every year for 9 years. the only change I make is to do 3/4 C water and 1/4 C brandy (I am from Wisconsin). it makes a huge batch so you can take to more than one thanksgiving or keep to serve warm over vanilla ice cream
Have been making this recipe for the past 5 years. Always a hit with a double purpose. First we eat it as a spread on top of cream cheese with crackers and then we eat it with our holiday meal.

I make this every year! I use the SunMaid fruit bits and I think it adds a little more flavor and texture. I serve it at room temp at Holidays and everyone loves it as leftovers straight from the fridge.
My family was okay with this recipe, just wasn't their favorite. Unfortunately, we won't make this again, but I think the recipe itself is a well made one that many people would enjoy.
Best cranberry relish I ever tasted.
Best Cranberry sauce ever. I omit the dried fruit. Still the best.

We love this so much that we've made it three times since Christmas. Today I changed the recipe a little because I had apples and oranges that needed to be eaten. I added four small oranges and three small apples. Cut the sugar back to 2/3 cup. Still delicious. Thank you for sharing!
